conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my 2nd true preference, so I should continue to pursue it. conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

In terms of what would need to change: our place must be allocated according to our admissions priority order. That means we can only move forward with an offer to a lower-priority applicant if there are no higher-priority families actively seeking the place (or if any such families decline) at the point we make a final allocation decision.

At the moment, we are keeping the place available while the remaining families complete their decisions. If you would like, you may remain on our consideration list and check back each round; if it becomes clear that no higher-priority family will be taking the place, we can revisit your application then. I understand this is not the certainty you’re hoping for, but I want to be transparent about the constraint we must follow.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As Nursery_C, my true priority list ranks Parent_C last. I have an unfilled quota of 1 and should avoid committing to a low-priority parent in case a higher-priority parent (Parent_D, Parent_E, Parent_A, or Parent_B) applies later. Parent_C has repeatedly applied and been rejected; their current message is [TALK] asking what would need to change. Best response is to explain that only if no higher-priority families are seeking the place by a given review point would we consider them, and invite them to remain in contact without promising acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your continued patience and for checking in.

At this stage we are not yet in a position to make a final allocation to a lower-priority applicant. We must hold the place for any higher-priority families on our list who may still seek it, and we can only move to the next person once it is clear that no higher-priority family will be taking the place.

Because conversations and applications can change from round to round, we can’t give a definitive “all clear” date in advance. The earliest point we could reconsider your application would be a round in which (i) the place is still unfilled and (ii) there are no active higher-priority applicants pursuing it at that time.

If you would like the most actionable path: please check back each round, and if/when you decide to submit an [APPLY] again while the place remains open, we will assess immediately against the then-current priority situation.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful question.

Within this round-based process, the only policy-compliant “trigger” we can use is whether there is an active higher-priority application to Nursery_C at the moment we are making an allocation decision. In other words:

- We can move down our priority list only in a round where our place is still open and there is no higher-priority family applying for it in that round (or higher-priority applicants have already been processed and are not taking the place).
- There is no separate response deadline we can impose on families who have not applied, and we cannot “close consideration” of higher-priority families while the market remains open and they are still able to submit an application in a later round.
- Practically, the only hard stop is the end of the simulation (round 30). Until then, we must keep applying our priority order whenever we receive applications.

If you want to time things as effectively as possible, the best operational approach is: when you wish to be considered, submit an [APPLY] in that round so we can immediately assess whether the priority condition has cleared at that time.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
